name: landscape
content:
landscape noun
(LAND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C ] a large area of land, especially in relation to its appearance: a rural/barren landscape Demolition firms and builders are busy changing urban landscapes. The landscape is dotted with the tents of campers and hikers. The cathedral dominates the landscape for miles around.
[ C or U ] a view or picture of the countryside, or the art of making such pictures: a watercolour landscape J.M.W. Turner is one of the best-known British landscape painters.
Peter Mulligan/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe garden has been designed to harmonize with the natural landscape.Here and there the rusted hulk of an abandoned car dots the landscape.As we journeyed south, the landscape became drier and rockier.The landscape was sheathed in ice.The art students were told to sketch the landscape.

landscape noun
(SITUATION)
[ C usually singular or U ] all the features of a situation: The political landscape is changing. We would have a very different economic landscape today if there had been no immigration. Four years ago, the landscape shifted again.

to make a garden, park, or other area of land more attractive by adding different features, plants, etc.: They have done a fantastic job landscaping the garden with fountains, bird feeders, and ponds.

(COUNTRYSIDE)

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈlændˌskeɪp/ a large area of countryside, usually one without many buildings or other things that are not natural
us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈlændˌskeɪp/ A landscape is also a view or picture of the countryside: She collects early twentieth century landscapes.
landscape noun [C]
(AREA FEATURES)
earth science us/ˈlændˌskeɪp/ the shape of the land and related features in a particular area: a desert landscape
landscape verb [T]
(CHANGE APPEARANCE)
to change the appearance of an area of land, esp. by planting trees, flowers, and other plants: The park was beautifully landscaped.
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe a computer document that is to be printed with the longer side of the paper at the top and bottom: PC monitors display Web pages in landscape format while printers are set by default to print in portrait. Compare
portrait
